title: Naomi Richards
text:
I am an early career librarian and bibliometrician who is passionate about responsible metric use and highlighting impact and knowledge dissemination using Alternative Metrics. My other professional interests include forensic scientometrics, open research, and visual data storytelling!
Outside of work, I love reading, knitting, and hiking! I also love learning languages, although I wouldn’t say I’m particularly good at it, and besides English I speak a little French, Dutch, and Italian (all very badly)!

title: Curriculum vitae
text:
Library and Information Management Experience
Research Intelligence Librarian

University of Derby, Derby, UK
June 2025 - Present
Duties include:

Leveraging research intelligence data to support strategic requests by University Leaders in relation topics such as institutional rankings (specifically KEF and REF), institutional open access impact and more
Developing and giving instructional sessions to researchers and post-graduate students on responsible research metric use, SciVal, Alternative metrics (including Altmetrics, Plum Metrics, Policy Citations etc.), and Citation network tools (Inciteful Citation Atlas, Litmaps, Connected Papers)
Developing new and enhancing already existing instructional material related to responsible research metric use, including internal Sharepoint pages, LibGuides, and a Responsible Research Metrics Module hosted on GitHub
Providing a responsive enquiry service to support researchers regarding all topics related to research metrics / bibliometrics, including metric methodology, specific metric guidance and best practices, SciVal usage, Altmetrics etc.
Designing and producing quarterly and yearly reports for the Library Services Research and Publication Practice Team to highlight trends in institutional repository deposits, publication trends, ORCiD registration numbers, non-academic collaborators etc.
Working alongside the university Impact Team to educate academics on REF, as well as support academics through the REF process, specifically the Engagement and Impact statements
Assessing and providing feedback on both open access (OpenAlex, OpenCitations etc.) and proprietary (InCites, Altmetric Explorer) resources for both institutional bibliometric purposes as well as for transformative agreement assessment (particularly InCites)
Working with the Publication Practice Librarian and Publication Practice Manager to enhance institutional repository usability for all university members through projects such as the consolidation of author affiliations, and addition of Altmetric badges
Liaising with University leaders, academic staff and professional services staff to build positive relationships, and work collaboratively in order to promote responsible metric use. This includes activity participating as a member of various working groups across the institution, for example, the Open Research Group


Assistant Librarian of Academic Engagement

University of Brighton, Brighton, UK
September 2024 - May 2025
Duties included:

Developing and giving instructional sessions to students on library services, literature searching, referencing, and EndNote
Providing drop in one-on-one support to students regarding topics such as literature searching, reference, EndNote etc.
Supporting collections development and information resource budgeting for the School of Humanities as well as the School of Architecture, Technology, and Engineering
Liaising with department faculty and academic staff Supporting academic staff in the creation and development of module reading lists using Tails Aspire software


Library Circulation Assistant

Dalhousie University, Halifax, CA
September 2023 - April 2024
Duties included:

Charging and discharging library material to patrons
Organizing and shelving of library material, according to the Library of Congress call number system


Records Management Intern

Canadian Wildlife Service, Sackville, CA
May 2023 - August 2023
Duties included:

Establishing intellectual and physical control over a collection of research and grey literature by developing an inventory of over 600 items using Excel and OpenRefine
Writing a Library Collection Management Policy as well as a Deselection and Disposal Policy pertaining to the collection of physical materials within the scope of the inventory. These documents outline and guide the upkeep and future maintenance of the collection
Visualizing key factors in the collection (number of items kept vs. deaccessioned, number of items with digital copies, most prolific authors etc.) through Excel, Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Power BI in order to facilitate understanding of the collection holdings
Developing a File Plan Structure and Information Architecture, including a folder structure, naming convention, and version control strategy to increase the productivity of shared drive use and navigation for all team members
Constructing an automated system for the disposal or isolation of files in a shared folder using Microsoft Power Automate Desktop (PAD) and Excel (using Macros and VBA Coding), expediting the process of file isolation and clean up by hundreds of hours


Bishop White Committee Library Intern

Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto, CA
April 2023 - May 2023
Duties included:

Establishing an inventory of the Bishop White Committee Library rare book collection in order to gain intellectual and physical control over the uncatalogued material
Evaluating material in regard to traditional Japanese book elements and bookbinding styles


Library Circulation Assistant

University of British Columbia
September 2019 - May 2020
Duties included:

Organization and shelving of library material, including the Canadian Art Exhibition Catalogue Collection, according to the Library of Congress call number system
Charging and discharging library materials to patrons
Retrieving material from UBC’s Automated Storage and Retrieval System
